[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Integration: CheckSummary] [Score aggregation] CheckSummary averages all checker scores - can attackers exploit many passing checks to dilute the impact of BuildVersionChecker failures in aggregate score? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Integration: CheckerError::is_retryable] [Retry logic exploitation] If MissingDataError is non-retryable but ProviderError is retryable, can attackers manipulate which error type is returned to enable/disable retries strategically? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Integration: CommonCheckerConfig.required] [Mandatory validation bypass] If required=false in config, check returns empty vec - can attackers set this to disable build version validation entirely without detection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Edge case: Empty check_results] If both baseline and target are missing, check_results could be empty vec - does upstream code handle empty results safely or assume at least one result? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Edge case: Very long hashes] If build_commit_hash values are extremely long (malicious or corrupted data), can this cause stack overflow in format! macros or excessive memory allocation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Edge case: Special characters] Can build_commit_hash contain special characters like newlines, quotes, or escape sequences that break string handling downstream? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Edge case: Non-UTF8 data] Although Rust strings are UTF-8, can invalid UTF-8 in underlying data cause panics during String conversion from SystemInformation HashMap? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Edge case: Null pointer] Are there any unsafe blocks or FFI calls that could result in null pointer dereference when accessing config or provider data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [DoS: Repeated check calls] Can attackers trigger check() repeatedly to exhaust provider cache, network bandwidth, or CPU resources through constant system_information endpoint queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [DoS: String allocation] Multiple string allocations in format! macros (lines 87, 100, 120-123, 129-132) - can attackers cause OOM through maliciously large hash strings? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [DoS: Error propagation] CheckerError propagation creates new error objects with context - can deep error chains cause stack overflow or excessive memory usage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [DoS: Provider timeout] If SystemInformationProvider hangs or has very long timeout, can attackers cause DoS by making check() hang indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Info leak: Build hashes in results] CheckResult explanation includes both baseline and target hashes (lines 121-122, 130-131) - does this leak sensitive version information to unauthorized observers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Info leak: Error messages] Error message 'Failed to get system information from your node' (line 87) - does 'your node' leak topology information about which node is target vs baseline? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Info leak: Timing] Different code paths for matching vs mismatching hashes - can attackers use response timing to infer if nodes are version-synchronized without seeing actual results? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Info leak: Missing data signals] When baseline is missing data, CheckerError exposes this vs target missing returns CheckResult - does this asymmetry leak information about baseline node capabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Crypto: Hash comparison] Build commit hashes are git SHA-1 or SHA-256 hashes - does string comparison properly handle hash format without cryptographic verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Crypto: No signature verification] Build hashes are compared directly without signature verification - can attackers forge matching hashes without access to private signing keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Crypto: Hash truncation] If hashes are shortened (first 7-8 chars common in git), does comparison validate full hash or accept short hashes vulnerable to collision attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trust boundary: Baseline provider] Baseline provider data is implicitly trusted - if baseline is compromised, can attackers establish malicious build as 'correct' reference? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trust boundary: Target provider] Target provider failures return CheckResult with score 0 but still Ok() - does this properly propagate that target is untrusted vs baseline? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trust boundary: SystemInformation source] SystemInformation comes from /system_information endpoint - is this endpoint authenticated? Can attackers substitute fake data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Config: required flag] CommonCheckerConfig.required determines if missing provider is error or OK - can attackers manipulate this to disable critical version checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Config: Deserialization defaults] Using #[serde(default)] could allow attackers to omit critical config fields that default to unsafe values - are all config fields explicitly required? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Config: Clone semantics] Config is cloned in new() - if config is mutated elsewhere, can stale config clones cause inconsistent validation behavior? (Low)
